intro: Mirbelia ferricola, commonly known as the ironwood acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is known for its hard, dense wood, which is resistant to decay and insect damage. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Mirbelia ferricola plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
